extracted_playbook.title: Review Microsoft Security Advisory and Customer Guidance
extracted_playbook.description: Review the Microsoft Security Advisory and the Microsoft Customer Guidance for CVE-2019-0708 to understand the vulnerability and recommended actions.

extracted_playbook.title: Install Available Patches
extracted_playbook.description: Apply the security updates released by Microsoft to patch the vulnerability, including patches for Windows Vista, Windows XP, and Windows Server 2003.

extracted_playbook.condition: Are there systems that cannot be patched?

extracted_playbook.title: Upgrade End-of-Life Operating Systems
extracted_playbook.description: Consider upgrading any EOL OSs no longer supported by Microsoft to a newer, supported OS, such as Windows 10.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Unnecessary Services
extracted_playbook.description: Disable services not being used by the OS to limit exposure to vulnerabilities.

extracted_playbook.title: Enable Network Level Authentication
extracted_playbook.description: Enable Network Level Authentication in Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, and Windows Server 2008 R2 to force session requests to be authenticated.

extracted_playbook.title: Block TCP Port 3389 at Enterprise Perimeter Firewall
extracted_playbook.description: Block TCP port 3389 at the enterprise perimeter firewall to prevent exploitation of BlueKeep from outside the network.
